intro: Indocalamus mairei, commonly known as the Maire bamboo, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is native to China and is characterized by its tall, slender culms that can reach heights of up to 10 meters. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are typically green on the upper surface and lighter in color on the underside. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in mountainous regions. Indocalamus mairei is valued for its ornamental appeal and is also used in traditional Chinese medicine.
